comments.commentBody: I wonder if that was effective. Unfortunately, my experience with youngsters is that forbidding them something makes it exciting to them. Perhaps some discussion of the problem?  One might assume that they are good kids, and could figure out for themselves what a nebbish the guy is?

I did not believe that Trump's statement was 'off the cuff'.  I wasn't aware of Wilmington's history.  Now that I do, I know his statement was planned and his response clarifying (excusing) his comments, written in advance.

Mr. Trump said all this in WIlmington, NC -- the sight of the only "successful" coup d'etat in American history. White Democrats overthrew, by force of arms, an elected mixed-race local government in 1898, and the Governor didn't do much about it.  The echo of his words now with those actions then is curious.

When is the FBI going to charge Trump with encouraging an assassination?? What is going to take to indite him Trump inciting for a riot?? No one stopped Hitler and we got a WW2 . WW3 is next unless does FBI does their job.

Collins is ranked the "most bipartisan Republican" in the Senate. For one thing, she supports a vote on Merrick Garland. She doesn't see things your way, or mine, because she's actually a traditional Republican, but she is, to borrow a phrase, a sane, competent adult. She is neither a fool nor a fraud.
Sorry, it should have been "electorate as a whole". I also had said before he was a farce, but that is too kind. He is a DANGEROUS farce!

Some call this a "dog whistle". It is heard by a certain segment of the population in a different way than other segments or the electorate as a who;e.

Hitler used the same tactic to incite his followers.

I actually expect the leaders of the Republican Party to put a stop to this, it is grossly un-American to make threats while running for office. Get this candidate off the ticket so he can no longer denigrate American citizens, those running for office and those not. There has to be some legal means of doing this...an insanity clause perhaps?

If any of us as normal citizens made a similar public statement about assassinating a presidential candidate in front of thousands, I imagine we would all face immediate and quite drastic action whether we claimed were joking or not.  Why isn't he?

Trump needs to be treated as any other citizen would be for making such a public
statement.

I have been thinking the exact same way. His adult children need to STOP him and stop him NOW. They must be mortified beyond their wildest nightmares.
What is many times scarier though, actually terrifying to myself and MY adult children, are the fans or supporters of Trump who think he is Presidential material.
Susan Collins is indeed admirable and qualified.
And where is Dr. Condi Rice when the Republicans , the country, need her? She is a Russian expert, perhaps THE Russian expert, we WILL need. Yes, she supported Bush in the Iraq invasion, HUGE error, but so did H.R.Clinton, so did the national media.....
Where is Colin Powell? Has the GOP been completely gutted? Is all that is left the Tea Party and Far Right? Even some of them are disgusted and ashamed of Trump as candidate. Wow, never thought I'd think let alone write this, where is Ted Cruz?
The simple truth is that H.R.C. must be elected in November. Never thought I'd think, let alone write that!
Sorry to disappoint you but Ms. Collins earlier said in response to Trump's comments that she was sure he didn't mean it the way it was being interpreted.

Donald Trump's adult children would earn the eternal gratitude of fellow Americans by telling him, "Dad, we love you, but your campaign needs to end ... right now." The Republican Party could then get a second chance to choose a nominee who possesses the most fundamental quality demanded of a president: mature judgment. This man has none.

A wise choice would be Susan Collins of Maine, a highly competent four-term senator who just this week reminded everyone of her courage, character and sense of decency. This would have the added advantage of ensuring, come Nov. 8, that the United States would elect its first woman president.

Of course it's illegal to make extraordinarily veiled and vague statements partially in jest, certainly without any specific intent to do harm.   Since America has no first amendment or no commitment to legal protection of controversial speech, these kinds of statements are clearly illegal.  Trump should be jailed for conspiracy to commit murder.  Hillary's bodyguards should increase their gun arnsenal and ordinary citizens should be disarmed.  The second amendment only applies militias and by extension the secret service and other law enforcement.  Ordinary law abiding citizens should be disarmed, only the police, jailers, the military and criminals should be armed; this was the intent of the second amendment

@Dan Stackhouse,
Dear Dan, I am forced to quote again:
"In the last week, following Trump's suggestion that the Russians hack Clinton's server"
Nobody hack a server that doesn't exist...
Trump never asked Russians to hack into DNC. And he could not ask them to hack into the Clinton's nonexistent server. But you, Dan, anti-Trump warrior, only capable of denying all truth, so I doubt you'll acknowledge this one.
Hillary is now leading in Georgia. Hope it stays that way.

Listen to his delivery and his tone. There was nothing "off the cuff" about that remark. His intent was perfectly clear in his mind and in the minds of his audience. His minions trying to put an innocent spin on it is pathetic and insulting.

What a truly nasty piece of humanity.
Powerful contrast to DT and his like of heart or class.

No, if you listen to the comment, he is talking about Americans not having any recourse once Hillary appoints a supreme court judge.  Then he said, well maybe the 2nd amendment people can do something.  He's not talking about voting at that point.  Besides, Sarah Palin once also referred to a "2nd amendment solution." No one is being ridiculous.  This is for real.

At this point, it is not about what he said and what he actually meant or did not mean.  It's about his inability to think ahead and foresee the possible unintended consequence of his words.  Or his failure to self-correct and instead, his encouragement of snickering among the audience.  All of us can misspeak.  The problem with Trump is that he constantly misspeaks or says inappropriate things AND he is running for presidency.  The combination of the two is what creates a huge problem.
And you will be the one deciding what constitutes "responsible speech"? Slippery slope. Free speech is free speech. Suck it up.
No, it's not a slippery slope.  It is a CRIME to threaten anyone.  That being the case, isn't it also a crime to encourage other people to harm or to kill someone?

Mr. Friedman brings up a very serious point about humanity that illustrates the danger of the guns everywhere push by the right. People are not rational. People are emotional. Some of us are just plain nuts. Furthermore, many of us are on the edge and can go nuts at any moment. What is road rage? Why get upset because someone changed lanes in front of you? Who cares? But yet road rage happens everyday, committed by so called rational people.

Then we have the free speech libertarian types who believe that anyone should be able to say anything anywhere. This is another push toward crazy fostered by the right. And of course the internet, with its social networking, amplifies crazy talk by orders of magnitude.

Those that have fallen off the edge of rational behavior suck this stuff up. Only one of them has to pull the trigger and change world events. But oh my, do we love to say crazy stupid things. Do we ever love to incite passion, especially hate and anger.

For free speech to work and serve any useful purpose in society, it has to be responsible speech. Here come the strict constitutionalists and great legal minds warning about the speech police and how do you identify it and how do you enforce it. Well folks, it's real simple. Don't threaten to kill anyone or incite others to kill anyone. This isn't another slippery slope argument. It's an argument about falling off a cliff into chaos and mob rule.
The verdict is what we both expected: "quintuple stupid."  Why did I bother?

By the way, Democrats are NOT coming to take your guns. That was invented by Republicans to get you mad. Look it up, please; if you believe that you'd believe anything.  (Unfortunately, too many people do believe stuff like that, sad.)
You can't make this stuff up!
Ha ha, those boys were sure funny together.

Martin, sometimes I feel bad that I am the only one who is getting what you are saying. Bad like a Liberal's guilt trip. But then I return to reason and common sense.

64-49 x 2

10-4
She said it in her DNC acceptance speech...something like "I'm not going to take your guns away...just keep someone who shouldn't have one from using it against you."
She has said it, lots of times. She said it in her convention speech.
If you are claiming that Hillary Clinton said in her convention speech that she intended to abolish the Second Amendment then you are either delusional or as big a liar as Trump.

Sure, Trump is flippant and inflamatory, but Hilary Clinton should simply come out and say explicitly that SHE WILL NOT TAKE AWAY the right to bear arms. She just needs to say it and deflate his bull-oon. There are people out there who will believe him about anything if she does not refute it. She should categorically say that she supports the right to bear arms. Making common sense regulations of semi automatic weapons and high number magazines is NOT taking away the right to bear arms and reasonable people know this. Hillary Clinton should come out and call a spade a spade. I wouldn't be surprised if Donald starts in soon about reptilians and the Clintons drinking the blood of infants, he is truly beyond reason at this point.
That's my position as well. Ryan and McConnell have stuck by him for all of his previously outrageous statements and they will also this time. Good.

I'm torn as to how soon Trump should be gone. On the one hand, his very presence as a candidate is an offense to the country. On the other, he needs to stay on just long enough to ensure the destruction of the Republican Party as we know it and a resounding loss in November.

It seems at the "ripe age" of 70 Mr Trump is definitely losing the frontal lobe functions---very little if any control over his temper, no thoughtfulness, poor social grace, inappropriate joking and punning, inability to follow his own thoughts and coming out with random senseless comments and ----- no insight whats so ever. This whistling mad has a chance to hold  our nations nuclear code!!!!! God "really" bless America.

If he said it, he meant it.

Only Trump's campaign people are claiming it was a "joke."
